heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 22.9 hours on 04 January 2025 (ranking 5th from our records for the longest storm) and it produced a total of 7.68mm of rain at a maximum intensity of 4.1mm per hour.  The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 02 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (204°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.5°C) and outside temperature (down 4.5°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 10%) and rainfall (down 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.2 mm), cloud levels (up 298 m), and light levels (up 3877 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 694.1m higher than yesterday, 180.3m lower than the past week, 297.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 568m minimum and 931m maximum, with an average of 1423.7m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1604.0m and 1721.4m.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and calm and still conditions are expected. Chance of light rain, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and periods of sunshine are expected. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
